online.search
Class commonRobot<BOARDTYPE extends BoardProtocol>

java.lang.Object
  online.search.commonRobot<BOARDTYPE>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Runnable, RobotProtocol, SimpleRobotProtocol
Direct Known Subclasses:
CheckerPlay, HexPlay
public abstract class commonRobot<BOARDTYPE extends BoardProtocol>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, RobotProtocol, java.lang.Cloneable

this is the base class for all robots. It contains the connective tissue to connect the robot to the game framework and the search engine, so all your actual robot class needs to do is move and evaluate.

Author:
ddyer

Field Detail

board

public BOARDTYPE extends BoardProtocol board
our local copy of the game board

GameBoard

public BOARDTYPE extends BoardProtocol GameBoard
the actual game board

RANDOMIZE

public boolean RANDOMIZE
if true, the first few moves of a game are randomized. If false, the fixed "best move" line is played out. This is actually implemented in your DoFullMove() method

RANDOMSEED

public long RANDOMSEED

DEFAULT_SEARCH_DEPTH

public static int DEFAULT_SEARCH_DEPTH
this is the "default default" value, but normally overridden by the value supplied to Setup_For_Search(int, boolean)

DEFAULT_ALPHA_BETA

public static boolean DEFAULT_ALPHA_BETA
default for using alpha-beta pruning is true. There's no reason to change this except for desperate debugging measures.

DEFAULT_GOOD_ENOUGH

public static boolean DEFAULT_GOOD_ENOUGH
default for cutting off a search when the result is "good enough", where the good enough value is a winning move. The effect of this is to find "a" winning move, not necessarily keep looking for the best winning move.

DEFAULT_PROGRESSIVE_SEARCH

public static boolean DEFAULT_PROGRESSIVE_SEARCH
if true, true a progressive deepening search. This works well for some games. The actual value if this is normally determined by the call to Setup_For_Search(int, boolean)

root

public RootAppletProtocol root
the applet root

robotRunning

public boolean robotRunning
true if the robot is running (ie; searching) "right now"

continuous

public boolean continuous
if true, continue waiting for the next turn, otherwise exit after completing one search. This is normally true, but will be false if using the "test one robot move" menu item.

exitFlag

public boolean exitFlag
this is set to true when the robot is being asked to stop early.

game

public Game game
this is the game controller from which we started.

getInitialWinRate

public double getInitialWinRate(commonMove m,
                                commonMove[] mm)
Description copied from interface: RobotProtocol
For UCT searches, return the initial bias for "wins" of a particular move. Nominally this should be in the range of -1 to 1. The exact values only matter relative to the other children of the same parent. This number is combined with the search driver UCTMoveSearcher.initialWinRateWeight. This combination effectively provides the results for a fixed number of fake visits that bias the initial probabilities that this child will be investigated further.

Specified by:
getInitialWinRate in interface RobotProtocol
mm - the full list of moves at this level
Returns:
a double in -1 to 1

Tree_Depth_Limit

public boolean Tree_Depth_Limit(int current)
Description copied from interface: RobotProtocol
for UCT searchers, return true if the tree part should be limited here. default is false;

Specified by:
Tree_Depth_Limit in interface RobotProtocol

Width_Limit_Moves

public int Width_Limit_Moves(int depth,
                             int max,
                             commonMove[] mvec,
                             int sz)
Limit the move vector to a specified size. The vector is full of moves that have been static evaluated and sorted, so removing from teh end is appropriate.

Specified by:
Width_Limit_Moves in interface RobotProtocol
Parameters:
depth - current depth of search
max - current max depth
mvec - a sorted array of moves
sz - the current number of those
Returns:

Setup_For_Search

public Search_Driver Setup_For_Search(int depth,
                                      boolean pro)
set up for a search, but don't actually start it.

Parameters:
depth - the target search depth

Setup_For_Search

                                      double progressive_time)
set up for a progressive deepening search, but don't actually start it

Parameters:
depth - is the maximum depth
progressive_time - time limit, in minutes

set up for a progressive deepening search, but don't actually start it.

Parameters:
depth - max depth
progressive_time - a double, time limit in minutes
first_depth - depth of the first search in the progressive search

targetMoveForEvaluation

public commonMove targetMoveForEvaluation(commonMove cm)
Description copied from interface: RobotProtocol
return the move that should be re-evaluated for search purposes. For 2 player games this is the same move. For multiplayer games it's the ultimate leaf node.

Specified by:
targetMoveForEvaluation in interface RobotProtocol
Returns:
a move spec

reScorePosition

public double reScorePosition(commonMove cm,
                              int forplayer)
Description copied from interface: RobotProtocol
re-score the value of the move as it is being passed to the caller. For 2 player games, the default implementation will handle this correctly by negating the value if the player changes. For multiplayer games, the static evaluation should store separate values for each player to allow recalculating the value for the desired player.

Specified by:
reScorePosition in interface RobotProtocol
